Hi Becky, well done, it is good to be able to track down things like 
thing=
s. Just for your information

Washika (spelling) should read WAKIZASHI
End =
cap should read KASHIRA
and Collar should read FUCHI

I think you are wise =
to hang onto your sword, if it is part of the 
family history, you should k=
eep it fo rno other reason than that.

Good luck for the future.

Richard T=
urner


BECKY WALLACE wrote:
>
> I'd like to thank everyone who has been he=
lping me with Japanese Sword 
> info lately. We did go to the Gun show here=
 in Dallas today. Sold the 
> WWII Japanese rifle we had - it was not a ver=
y good piece and I'm glad 
> to have it out of the closet. Had several peop=
le look at the sword. 
> The blade, as has been pointed out by some of you,=
 was not signed and 
> it has one nick that is slightly too big to be polis=
hed out, which 
> detracts considerably from the value. There was concuranc=
e that this 
> sword was made in the 1600s and is a Washika (spelling) the =
shoter 
> sword. Everyone liked the tsuba, end cap and collar. I got offere=
d 
> about $500 for the tsuba and $100 each for the collar and end cap, but=
 
> just $300 for the whole thing! The conclusion I came to was that a gun =

> show was really more like a giant pawn shop than the place to really 
> =
get a fair assessment of value, but it was very interesting, I ran 
> into =
at least 3 of my co-workiers from Lockheed who had booths, and I 
> did com=
e
> away knowing a few things: 1. the sword is old and really not in bad 
>=
 shape - I can continue to use it in the event of an intruder and could 
> =
probably take one out with it - I'm not a handgun fan :-) 2. If I 
> really=
 had it appraised, documented, or auctioned, I'd get $1500 or so 
> for it,=
 3. I like it more than that so will be keeping it for the 
> forseeable fu=
ture. I'll probably drop out of this group in a few weeks 
> having accompl=
ished my mission, but thanks for the education. I can 
> sure see how this =
could become a very interesting hobby.
>
> Becky
>
